DataElement.preferredName: Performance Status Initial Score Less Initial Pathologic Diagnosis Date Calculated Day Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Time interval in days from the date of the patient's initial pathologic diagnosis to the date that the initial score for the Performance Status Scale was obtained.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Performance Status Initial Score Subtract Diagnosis Time Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._The act of removing a part from the whole._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Performance Status First Score Subtraction Diagnosis Time
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.:The act of removing a part from the whole.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: A measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
The act of removing a part from the whole.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Property.preferredDefinition: The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: The period of time during which something continues.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created and released for TCGA per approval by B.McClure-Shimel. mc 6/14/12

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours._The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours.:The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Calculation created for TCGA content requested by Dr. Ari Kahn.  This VD uses a calculation of dividing a value by the number of milliseconds in a day (86,400,000) to result in a number of days, stored as a whole number.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Number of Days from Date of I
ReferenceDocuments.description: Number of Days from Date of Initial Pathologic Diagnosis to the Date Initial Score Obtained for the Performance Status Scale

DataElement.changeDescription: Created and released for TCGA per approval by B.McClure-Shimel. mc 6/14/12
